title: Calories in a Crab Cake
meta_description: Discover calories in crab cake, including full nutrition breakdown per serving, macros, and variations for baked or fried prep.
assumptions: Standard fried crab cake (~100 g), made with lump crab meat, breadcrumbs, mayonnaise, egg, and seasonings; pan-fried in minimal oil.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, crab type, binders, frying method, and portion size. Check restaurant or package labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One standard crab cake has about 220 kcal, with 12 g protein and 14 g fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one crab cake?
faqs.a: Approximately 220 kcal for a standard 100 g fried crab cake.

faqs.q: What are the macros in a crab cake?
faqs.a: About 12 g protein, 14 g fat, 12 g carbs, including 1 g fiber.

faqs.q: Are crab cakes high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, typically around 500 mg sodium per crab cake due to seasonings.

faqs.q: How does baking affect calories in crab cake?
faqs.a: Baking reduces calories by about 50 kcal by avoiding frying oil.

faqs.q: Is there cholesterol in crab cakes?
faqs.a: Around 60 mg per serving, mainly from the crab and egg binder.
